question: Are there any anti-amyloid antibody approved as drug for Alzheimer's disease treatment?
ideal_answer: No new drugs have been approved during the past 15 years; and the available medications are not cost-effective.

snippets.text: Treatment with memantine, a noncompetitive NMDA receptor antagonist which is an approved drug for treatment of Alzheimer's disease, rescued protein phosphatase-2A activity by decreasing its demethylation at Leu309 selectively and attenuated Alzheimer's disease-like pathology and cognitive impairment in adeno-associated virus vector-1-I1PP2A rats.
no new drugs have been approved during the past 15 years; and the available medications are not cost-effective.
